thread.title: Cavs lose 2nd pre-season game to Philly 76ers
thread.title_full: Cavs lose 2nd pre-season game to Philly 76ers

title: Cavs lose 2nd pre-season game to Philly 76ers
text:
Next 
PHILADELPHIA - The Cleveland Cavaliers lost their second pre-season game Thursday night to the 76ers. 
The Cavs hit the court without several of its key players including LeBron James, Kyrie Irving, Kevin Love, Timofey Mozgov, and J.R. Smith. 
The Cavs dominated most of the game, but Philadelphia's Scottie Wilbekin made a 3-pointer with 1.3 seconds left to lift the Philadelphia 76ers to a 115-114 win. 
76ers' Jahlil Okafor, the No. 3 overall pick of the draft, scored 12 points on 4-of-12 shooting in his home debut. 
Cavs shooting guard Jared Cunningham led all scorers with 31 points. The 6-foot-4 guard made 8 of 10 shots and was 13 of 16 from the free throw line. Matthew Dellevedova scored 13 points. The Cavaliers blew a 19-point lead. 
Wilbekin's winner was his only shot attempt of the game. Jeremi Grant had 19 points and Nerlens Noel grabbed 10 rebounds. 
---
